required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Childhood Health, Activity, and Motor Performance School Study Denmark

brief_summary.textblock: The main aim of this study is to describe differences in development of health and motor performance over time in relation to type of school and other background variables.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Intervention group receiving 270 minutes of weekly physical education Control group receiving 90 minutes of weekly physical education Intervention group physical education teachers receiving physical education courses (ATK-concept)

primary_outcome.description: Standardized assessments performed by trained personal using an electronic scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) determined bone mineral content (grams)
primary_outcome.description: Standardized assessments performed by trained personal.

primary_outcome.measure: Musculoskeletal problems (injuries, defined as inability to participate in sports)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Total incidence of musculoskeletal problems across 2.5 years
primary_outcome.description: Weekly short-message-service tracking of participants to determine severity, frequency and nature (acute/overuse) of injuries.
Standardized assessments performed by trained personal using a stadiometer.
Calculated from measured height and weight
Standardized assessments performed by trained personal at the level of the umbilical cord
In subcohort only. Standardized assessments performed by trained personal.
Standardized assessments performed by trained biomedical laboratory technicians. Fasting status affirmed verbally.
Standardized assessments performed by trained biomedical laboratory technicians. Fasting status affirmed verbally.
Standardized assessments performed by trained biomedical laboratory technicians. Fasting status affirmed verbally.
Standardized assessments performed by trained biomedical laboratory technicians. Fasting status affirmed verbally.
Standardized assessments performed by trained biomedical laboratory technicians. Fasting status affirmed verbally.
Standardized assessments performed by trained biomedical laboratory technicians. Fasting status affirmed verbally.
Standardized assessments performed by trained biomedical laboratory technicians. Fasting status affirmed verbally.

primary_outcome.measure: Homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance (HOMA-IR)
primary_outcome.description: Calculated as fasting insulin (IU/l) x fasting glucose (mmol/l))/ 22.5
Standardized assessments performed by trained personal
Standardized assessments performed by trained personal
Standardized (z-scores) values of HOMA-IR, triglycerides, cholesterol-fractions, systolic blood pressure, and cardiorespiratory fitness
Performance on indirect cardiorespiratory fitness test (Andersen-test). Standardized assessments performed by trained personal
Maximal strength measured by a dynamometer. Standardized assessments performed by trained personal
Measured by the 50 meter short-shuttle test. Standardized assessments performed by trained personal
From the "Korperkoordinations Test fur Kinder". Standardized assessments performed by trained personal
Standardized assessments performed by trained personal
From ''Der Allgemeiner Sportmotorischer Test fur Kinder von 6-11 Jahren''

other_outcome.measure: Physical activity determined objectively using waist-worn accelerometry. Participants will be asked to wear the monitors for at least one week.
other_outcome.time_frame: Non-specific follow-up duration as multiple time-points are considered (follow-up at 2, 3.5 and 6.5 years)
other_outcome.description: Physical activity outcomes include; mean count/min, light-physical activity, moderate-physical activity, vigorous-physical activity. First physical activity assessment made during year 1 of the intervention

arm_group.description: Trebling of weekly curricular physical education (270 minutes per week)
Standard curriculum physical education (90 minutes per week)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled at school participating in study
- Grade 0 - 4
- written, informed consent provided by parent or legal guardian
Exclusion Criteria:

Klakk H, Andersen LB, Heidemann M, Møller NC, Wedderkopp N. Six physical education lessons a week can reduce cardiovascular risk in school children aged 6-13 years: a longitudinal study. Scand J Public Health. 2014 Mar;42(2):128-36. doi: 10.1177/1403494813505726. Epub 2013 Sep 20.

patient_data.ipd_description: Data are available upon request from the CHAMPS Study Steering Committee due to legal and ethical restrictions. Interested parties may contact Dr Niels Wedderkopp (nwedderkopp@health.sdu.dk), and the following information will be required at the time of application: a description of how the data will be used, securely managed, and permanently deleted.
